elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the factual text "Rights and duties".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: What are human rights?
elements.correctAnswer: General, supranational fundamental rights and freedoms. All people are entitled to them, regardless of skin color, origin, language, religion, nationality or gender.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What are the three civil rights in Switzerland?
elements.correctAnswer: Freedom of establishment; citizenship; protection against expulsion, extradition and deportation

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Name three civic duties.
elements.correctAnswer: Military service, civil defense, compulsory schooling, etc.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the factual text "Rights and duties".

elements.name: question3
elements.title: When are you granted political rights in Switzerland?

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What is the difference between the right to vote and the right to stand for election?
elements.correctAnswer: The right to vote entitles someone to elect people to an office or authority. The right to stand for election allows you to be elected to an office yourself.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: What do you mean by an absolute majority and what do you mean by a relative majority?
elements.correctAnswer: An absolute majority means that the person who has obtained more than half of all valid votes is elected. Invalid or blank ballot papers are not counted. A relative majority means that the person with the highest number of votes is elected. It is not necessary to achieve half of all votes.
